Package kcn.methodreferencing

Class MeRef<V,​O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • kcn.methodreferencing.MeRef<V,​O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMethodReference
    public class MeRef<V,​O>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMethodReference
    A MeRef lets you roll up a reference to an object and a method; and pass that method around and execute it from anywhere on command.

    - Supplied generic types:

    * generic type V is used input-parameters (Values)

    * generic type O is generally used as return type (Output)

    (The just-mentioned rule is broken in run(O,V), which returns an Object)

    Internal exception handling registers the different possible errors, and stops the MeRef instance from functioning if even a single exception happens; the exception is captured in the exceptionsCaught[] as ints for manual (user) processing. The MePack O,V is able to detect defect MeRefs and remove them automatically.

    * Object type (in parameters and return types) is here to allow manual type casting and greater flexibility.

        public O run​(V[] valuesArray)

        LIMITS:

        * cannot be used to return an array of primary types!

        Parameters:
        valuesArray - an array of type V objects.
        Returns:
        object of type O

      • run_ObjV

        public O run_ObjV​(java.lang.Object inputObject,
                  V value)
        Method takes a Object-object and a V-object as arguments, and returns an O-type object.

        - method takes first a parameter object of type Object

        - then method takes a parameter object type V

        - method returns a type O object

        - NB. the contained method must take care to cast the return Object to something useful.*

        - Method is named different because the compiler cannot distinguish between run(V,V) and run(Object,V), - and so run_ObjV was born. Sorry for the confusion.

        Parameters:
        inputObject - Object type object; any object (remember to type cast in executing method)
        value - an object of type V
        Returns:
        an O-type object

      • run

        public O run​(java.lang.Object inputObject,
             V[] valuesArray)
        Method takes an Object object and an array of objects of type V and returns an object of type O.

        LIMITS:

        * cannot be used to return an array of fundamental types!

        Parameters:
        inputObject - an object of type Object.
        valuesArray - an array of type V objects.
        Returns:
        object of type O

        public boolean isPersistentCheckingEnabled()

      • getExceptionDescriptionStrings

        public java.lang.String[] getExceptionDescriptionStrings()
        Returns array of strings representing possible error-types in order of the int-array counting caught exceptions exceptionsArray. The array represents the possible exceptions and null objects, but NOT and NEVER a log of actual events; method is provided mainly for debugging purposes for.
